page.title: 03Local History
page.content: In its halcyon days North Shields was a successful port with trading links all over the world.Sailors of all nationalities frequented the busy pubs and coffee houses and superstitious seamen needed something to act as a lucky charm before embarking on long, dangerous voyages. A wooden figure head, situated on Custom House Quay had long provided the lucky talisman for countless sailors. A piece was pared, chipped or broken off to guard against the dangers of the sea. Needless to say such misuse led to her demise. by Peter Bertram
